raw_output:
system
You are a helpful AI for medical imaging.
user
System:
You are extracting factual relations from a medical imaging lecture. Use only information grounded in the input SLIDE_TEXT.

User:
SLIDE_TEXT:
Last time, we explained to you the physical and mathematical principles for ultrasound imaging.

In this lecture, we will be more specific about how we can form different kinds of ultrasound images. We’re moving from principles to practice—how we send sound, receive echoes, and turn those echoes into the different image types for various clinical tasks.

STRICT INSTRUCTIONS:
- Return JSON only. No prose, no markdown, no code fences.
- Output a triple only if both subject and object appear verbatim in SLIDE_TEXT (case-insensitive).
- Predicates must be one of: uses | via | represents | depends_on | measures | produces | reconstructs_with.
- Add modalities ["text"] by default; add "image" only if clearly visible without the text.
- Confidence in [0,1].

OUTPUT:
{
  "triples": [
    {"s":"<verbatim subject>", "p":"uses|via|represents|depends_on|measures|produces|reconstructs_with",
     "o":"<verbatim object>", "modalities":["text","image"], "confidence":0.0, "evidence":"<short quote from SLIDE_TEXT>"}
  ]
}

assistant
{
  "triples": [
    {
      "s": "ultrasound imaging",
      "p": "produces",
      "o": "different kinds of ultrasound images",
      "modalities": [
        "text",
        "image"
      ],
      "confidence": 0.9,
      "evidence": "In this lecture, we will be more specific about how we can form different kinds of ultrasound images."
    }
  ]
}

triples.evidence: In this lecture, we will be more specific about how we can form different kinds of ultrasound images.
